title: My hotmail account will no longer send ( office365 auth failure)
content:
Hi My problem: My hotmail account will no longer send emails. The error message I get is 

 From Microsoft: "We can't sign you in Your browser is currently set to block cookies. You need to allow cookies to use this service."    (NB my Firefox browser cookies is set to 'standard' and the settings had not been changed.  Plus I've tried playing with the settings, makes no difference)   From Thunderbird: "Sending of the message failed. The message could not be sent because the connection to Outgoing server (SMTP) smtp.office365.com timed out. Try again."

When? Started on 6 or 7 Oct, At this point, both receive and send failed. Last message was just before a Thunderbird update. We were in France, using hotel internet, which Microsoft hates. (so I didn't try to fix it until we got home).

Other info: However my hotmail address still worked well on my laptop's Outlook; internet login, Thunderbird on another laptop (Win 11, and more recent installation of Tb) and on my phone (Android, FairEmail), ie has not been blocked. My usual laptop is Win 10. All other emails within my Thunderbird are working fine. The outgoing SMTP for hotmail is: smtp://smtp.office365.com (smtp://smtp.office365.com) See image attached.

What since: A forced update of Windows (as rec'd by local techy) restored the receive function and speed, which had become sluggish. Hotmail still can't send. I've logged in and out of my microsoft account online, and have changed my MS password (and therefore that of my hotmail account), plus restarted everything lots of times. No difference. I have not got office365 except what came free with windows. I avoid office/MS apps where possible.

PLUS: Discovered that my Tb profile is humungous, 45gb, of which a fair chunk is this last couple of weeks. Most of it is not visible emails. Any advice ? - can I start a new profile and ditch the old? 

                   Help please......................

Thanks Eunice Lord
creator: eunice.lord

title: New emails since 7pm last night, NOT coming thru, till NEXT day!
content:
I turned on pc, this morning. Opened Thunderbird. Checked for Updates; None. Thunderbird checks for new email from Gmail, then Compuserve (thru AOL). Taking about 3mins. Nothing past 7pm, last night. I go to Compuserve e-mail, on-line thru AOL. Messages waiting there from last night (past 7pm) and up to NOW. Had this happen before; within 2 months. If I wait until Tomorrow, the e-mails WILL come thru to my InBox. Of course then I have to go thru ALL that, PLUS today's stuff!! What is going on? I CAN read And reply thru on-line AND my connection thru my Cell phone. It can be good, on my Pc, with Thunderbird for a week or so, then Happens Again!! If I send myself a message from Gmail, it does NOT come to my Thunderbird Compuserve Inbox, but it Does show when I go On-line or to my Android Cell. I looked at my Thunderbird settings for anything that could be Filtering my e-mail, after 7pm (on Some days). Didn't see anything. I could just NOT Know Where that Particular Setting IS.... I CLOSE Thunderbird, then re-Open, and Do NOT get those NEW messages. Until a few months ago (after a 32 to 64bit update??), I don't think I had this problem (??). Even tried checking my Compuserve settings. NOTHING there, that I see that "looks" like it would cause this. When I click on Get Messages, even going to Specifically my Compuserve messages, on Thunderbird, a shaded line, on bottom right, keeps showing Something is going on, for a few minutes.

What Do I DO???

title: message filters
content:
Hi,

I've a couple of requests.

First, I've several email accounts on one Thunderbird client and populating all the message filters to have the same message filters is a pain.

I have my message filters named as:

Delete 0 Delete . Delete . Delete 9 Delete a Delete b Delete . Delete y Delete z Delete A Delete B Delete . Delete Y Delete Z

When I get a message I want to permanently delete and move to trash, I copy the email address from the email, open the appropriate Delete ? file and enter the information.

For example, presume I get an email from JoeSmoe@pigpen.nz

I copy the email address, open the Delete p filter and add the domain to the list. I've included a sample image below for a view.

So I'd really appreciate having the ability to export the filter lists and merging / importing them to other email accounts on the same Thunderbird client on the same machine or another Thunderbird client on another machine.

Second, as it pertains to the filter lists, is it possible to "sort" the list? I'm sure there are duplicate domains in the list and removing them would likely be beneficial for several reasons.

Are these requests reasonable and achievable?

Thanks in Advance ---Whack
creator: whack

title: Thunderbird startup is processing like crazy and consuming huge amounts of RAM
content:
I have been using Thunderbird on my computer (and predecessors) for many years. I restarted my Windows 10 system this morning and Thunderbird has gone crazy. By crazy, I mean: - It is running continuously at 16+% CPU continuously. - The application deploys the UI but becomes barely responsive. It seems like it is an infinite wait while processing something. - The RAM memory usage just keeps going higher and higher, consuming many gigabytes of memory and going up to 80-90% of my 32 GB of memory.

I've tried restarting TB many times and did a complete shut down of my computer and cold reboot.

It seems like it may be doing some kind of repair or re-indexing procedure. But it looks like that will take infinite time and memory.

Any help or suggestions would be welcome.

Thanks

CT

creator: ffiglozzi

title: Password and Profile issues
content:
I hope to explain my issue without going on too long. Please ask for clarification if I cut it too short.

I lost my Thunderbird in a disastrous crash. The Profile folder from the time of the crash isn't recoverable. Reinstalling Thunderbird worked fine including configuring my Gmail account however, there was no data (duh).

I managed to recover a Profile folder from 7/23/23. I renamed the existing Profile folder "Porfile" and copied the Profile folder as a subfolder under AppData/Local/Thunderbird. When I started Thunderbird, to my surprise the profile it used was the one the installer created. It worked perfectly but there was none of the data that exists in the 7/23/23 profile.

So I ran the Profile Manager (thunderbird.exe -p) finding several profiles listed. I chose default. Thunderbird then started with my data intact from July, 2023.

However, it said my password to Gmail was incorrect. I entered the correct one but Thunderbird said it or my user name was incorrect. So I setup a new Gmail account using Thunderbird which seemed to work OK. I added the data (I use POP) and the setup took me to the Gmail screen where I had to enter my password again to verify that I allowed Thunderbird to access my account.

After verification, I found no change in the list of emails. I was expecting one to day Gmail (1) or something since it was a dupe.

What could be preventing Thunderbird from recognizing I'm entering the correct user name and password for Gmail?

creator: warnerzeno

title: Unwanted large line spacing while sending emails since update to 115.3.3. (macOS)
content:
Hello everyone! Since the update to 115.3.3. (macOS), Thunderbird adds an unnaturally large line spacing (about 1.5 or 2.0) to emails that are composed in HTML mode, as well as to HTML signatures, which makes the messages very "long" and doesn't look nice. When the mails are created in plain text mode (i.e. without HTML), the line spacing is still regular at 1.0.

The problem has occurred in the same way on about 15 different Mac computers since the update. The setting under Settings>Compose is unchanged "Arial" with size "small". The option to use paragraph format instead of normal text was and is not activated, that's not the reason - especially since it's about the line spacing and not the spacing after a paragraph.

Therefore, I suspect that in (some) style files (CSS?) that contain the template for composing emails, the developers accidentally inserted a (too large) line spacing in the Mac version, which cannot be changed in the normal settings of Thunderbird, since there is no line spacing option there. With this in mind, I'd be very grateful for any advice on how we can fix this. The problem is probably not only with us, but probably with all Mac users who compose mails in HTML mode.

Attached are two photos, the first (with red bars) is how it used to be when sending mails with Thunderbird, and the other photo shows the state since the update. Please ignore the German language, but the content of the mails is not important :)
creator: 8nzfhb6gdf

I tried adding the account in Thunderbird, but says incoming server already exists, but, as said, it does not show in the email /passwords list! I am using ATT mailkeys for the passwords for each account in thunderbird. The non-working email is rudjnk@sbcglobal.net Suggestions? My email to contact is rudmail2@sbcglobal.net. Thanks for suggestions. Rudy
creator: astrorudy1rud

title: Thunderbird v115 Unresponsiveness and Crashes.
content:
Issue Description: I frequently encounter unresponsiveness and application crashes while using Thunderbird version 115 and subsequent updates. Even in the latest version, such as v115.4.1, the problem persists. I would like to know what measures should be taken to resolve this issue.

Operating System: Windows 7 Professional 64-bit

Please note that I have tried multiple versions of Thunderbird, and this issue occurs consistently across multiple installations. It hinders my ability to effectively manage my email using Thunderbird. I am looking for relevant support and solutions to address this problem.

Thanks.
creator: mis2
